alert.note: Alert for Bexar; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:42AM CDT until May 16 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Antonio River Near Elmendorf affecting Wilson and Bexar Counties. Cibolo Creek Near Falls City affecting Karnes County. San Antonio River near Floresville affecting Karnes and Wilson Counties. Medina River At Hwy 281 affecting Bexar County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Antonio River Near Elmendorf. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding inundates and damages crop and pastureland below San Antonio to below Floresville. Numerous roads and bridges are flooded. Oil well pump jacks and irrigation pumps are flooded and damaged. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning before cresting at 41.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall through Monday morning but rain in flood. A brief secondary rise to 36.0 feet is possible early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 40.1 feet on 06/01/1987. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue San Antonio River Elmendorf 35.0 18.7 Sat 7 am CDT 40.3 35.6 30.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
